queries.description: Adding declarations or definitions to standard namespaces or their sub-namespaces leads to undefined behavior.
queries.name: Non-standard entities shall not be added to standard namespaces

A17-6-1.title: Non-standard entities shall not be added to standard namespaces.

queries.description: A developer can more safely access the elements of an array if the size of the array can be explicitly determined.
queries.name: When an array with external linkage is declared, its size shall be stated explicitly

A3-1-4.title: When an array with external linkage is declared, its size shall be stated explicitly.

queries.description: A non-overriding member function definition that hides an inherited member function can result in unexpected behavior.
queries.name: Member function hides inherited member function

queries.description: An overriding member function definition thats hides an overload of the overridden inherited member function can result in unexpected behavior.
queries.name: Member function hides inherited member function

queries.description: A using declaration that makes a symbol available for unqualified lookup does not included definitions defined after the using declaration which can result in unexpected behavior.
queries.name: Using declaration followed by new definition

A7-3-1.title: All overloads of a function shall be visible from where it is called.

queries.description: The one-definition rule specifies when there should be a single definition of an element and a violation of that rule leads to undefined behavior.
queries.name: The one-definition rule shall not be violated

M3-2-2.title: The one-definition rule shall not be violated.

queries.description: A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in one and only one file to prevent inconsistent declarations that can result in unexpected behavior.
queries.name: A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in a single file

M3-2-3.title: A type, object or function that is used in multiple translation units shall be declared in one and only one file.

queries.description: An identifier with multiple definitions in different translation units leads to undefined behavior.
queries.name: An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one definition

M3-2-4.title: An identifier with external linkage shall have exactly one definition.

queries.description: If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier to make the internal linkage explicit.
queries.name: If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class

M3-3-2.title: If a function has internal linkage then all re-declarations shall include the static storage class specifier.

queries.description: An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility to prevent any accidental use of the identifier.
queries.name: An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility

M3-4-1.title: An identifier declared to be an object or type shall be defined in a block that minimizes its visibility.

queries.description: Declarations in the global namespace become part of the names found during lookup and reducing the set of found names ensures that they meet a developer's expectations.
queries.name: The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations

M7-3-1.title: The global namespace shall only contain main, namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations.

queries.description: Declaration of functions inside a function requires the use of ambiguous syntax that could lead to unintended behavior.
queries.name: Declare functions in the global namespace or other namespace

queries.description: An object declaration that declares an identifier that shadows an existing identifier relies on ambiguous syntax when initialized by a constructor and could lead to unintended behavior.
queries.name: Do not declare local identifiers that shadow an in scope identifier

DCL53-CPP.title: Do not write syntactically ambiguous declarations

queries.description: Allocation and deallocation functions can be overloaded and not providing an overload of a corresponding dynamic storage function can result in improper deallocation of dynamically allocated memory leading to undefined behavior.
queries.name: Overload allocation and deallocation functions as a pair in the same scope

DCL54-CPP.title: Overload allocation and deallocation functions as a pair in the same scope

queries.description: Adding declarations or definitions to the standard namespaces leads to undefined behavior and is only allowed under special circumstances described in the C++ Standard.
queries.name: Do not modify the standard namespaces

DCL58-CPP.title: Do not modify the standard namespaces

queries.description: Each translation unit has unique instances of members declared in an unnamed namespace leading to unexpected results, bloated executables, or undefined behavior due to one-definition rule violations if an unnamed namespace is introduced into translation units through a header file.
queries.name: Do not define an unnamed namespace in a header file

DCL59-CPP.title: Do not define an unnamed namespace in a header file

queries.description: The one-definition rule specifies when there should be a single definition of an element and a violation of that rule leads to undefined behavior.
queries.name: Obey the one-definition rule
